title: How to Make Chicken and Sweetcorn Soup

steps.headline: Pour the chicken consomme or broth in a large pot.
steps.description: Add the chicken breasts. Cook over high heat and let it boil.

steps.headline: Reduce the heat.
steps.description: Let the soup simmer for about five minutes, until the chicken cooks fully.

steps.headline: Remove the chicken breasts from the mixture.
steps.description: Place the chicken in a small bowl and have it cool fully. Once cool, shred the chicken finely. Set aside.

steps.headline: Pour the soy sauce and ginger into the broth mixture.
Whisk the water and cornflour in a separate small bowl.
steps.description: Do so until the mixture is well-combined and smooth.

steps.headline: Pour the cornflour mixture into the pot.
steps.description: Cook and mix with a wooden spoon for about two minutes, until the soup slightly thickens.

steps.headline: Add the shredded chicken, creamed corn, corn kernels, and mushrooms into the pot.
steps.description: Cook and slowly stir for about two minutes until the ingredients become hot.

steps.headline: Beat the egg whites with a fork or whisk in a separate bowl.
steps.description: Pour the egg whites into the soup and mix.

steps.headline: Have the soup cook for about two minutes, until white swirls appear on the soup.

steps.description: Season with a desired amount of black pepper and salt.

steps.headline: Serve.
steps.description: Pour the soup into serving bowls using a ladle. Serve with garlic bread or garnish with corn kernels. Enjoy!

text: Pour the chicken consomme or broth in a large pot. Add the chicken breasts. Cook over high heat and let it boil. Reduce the heat. Let the soup simmer for about five minutes, until the chicken cooks fully. Remove the chicken breasts from the mixture. Place the chicken in a small bowl and have it cool fully. Once cool, shred the chicken finely. Set aside. Pour the soy sauce and ginger into the broth mixture.  Whisk the water and cornflour in a separate small bowl. Do so until the mixture is well-combined and smooth. Pour the cornflour mixture into the pot. Cook and mix with a wooden spoon for about two minutes, until the soup slightly thickens. Add the shredded chicken, creamed corn, corn kernels, and mushrooms into the pot. Cook and slowly stir for about two minutes until the ingredients become hot. Beat the egg whites with a fork or whisk in a separate bowl. Pour the egg whites into the soup and mix. Have the soup cook for about two minutes, until white swirls appear on the soup.  Shut the stove off and remove the soup from heat.  Add the sesame oil and green shallots into the soup. Season with a desired amount of black pepper and salt. Serve. Pour the soup into serving bowls using a ladle. Serve with garlic bread or garnish with corn kernels. Enjoy!
